  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28201].
  {panel}

Quite a number of our customers ran into performance issues pairing Confluence with 64-bit JRE, and using less than 2GB of heap. This is apparently a known issue documented [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Garbage+Collector+Performance+Issues#GarbageCollectorPerformanceIssues-Use32bitJREifHeap%3C2GB]. 

Problem is, that documentation is not-obvious, and customers may not be aware of it until they start hitting into issues, and finally raising support tickets to resolve it. Naturally, if I am using a 64-bit OS, I would of course, download a 64 bit Confluence Installer. (note also that Confluence 64-bit comes pre-defined with low Xmx: 512m)

My suggestion would be to put a note (to warn customers of such a performance issue with 64bit Installers) in the following areas:
# The Confluence download page (most important place)
# https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide
fields.summary: Performance Issue with Running Confluence 64 bit paired with less than 2G of heap

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28179].
  {panel}

Some users wish to "watch" individual attachments, and be notified of changes, without having to watch an entire page.

For example, on a collaborative page that houses ten attachments, a user watching the page would be notified any time any of the ten attachments are changed, as well as any time the core page itself is modified. But all the user wants is to keep track of attachment A and be notified of its changes.

The question was posed on Atlassian Answers, and the recommendation was to set up an RSS to track the labels of the attachments. This is not quite going to achieve what we are looking for.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/134973/is-it-possible-to-watch-an-individual-attachment-rather-than-an-entire-page

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28166].

OnDemand users are not able to create user macros.  However, Atlassian recommends in their documentation to use a NoPrint macro to create content that should not be in an export. 

The export to PDF option is used often for creating customer-facing documentation.  However, not having the noprint doesn't allow a write to keep content together, with some content only pertinent for employees such as configuration, support, or implementation teams. 

Not having this requires us to create and maintain separate document which disrupts the flow and can be confusing. 

It would also address the current issue with the NoPrint attribute on the TOC being broken. We use the TOC often to assist with online navigation; but, it is not always appropriate to have this in exported, client-facing documentation. This would provide a workaround for this current bug.
fields.summary: Provide a 'NoPrint macro' in Confluence

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28145].
  {panel}

When I mention someone in a comment, I often want to write something like:

bq. "[Sam|http://google.com], what kind of home brews do you planned for summer?"

But it actually autocompletes to the full name like:

bq. "[Sam Haldane|http://google.com], what kind of home brews..."

It would be ideal if we autocompleted to just the first name in comments. Since comments are a conversation, rarely do you mention or address someone by their full name. While lurking in the HipChat room for FedEx 18 (see screenshot below), I noticed they do this nicely.

If you look at their [documentation|https://www.hipchat.com/help/page/how-do-mentions-work], they describe how it works:
bq. By default we will use someone's first name "@john". If there are two Johns, we will use their full name @"John Smith" to correctly identify them.

!https://img.skitch.com/20111027-g1xtq5b7y2cttc9xu1xem85hd1.jpg!

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28031].
  {panel}

At the present time, Confluence will not allow an administrator to edit the directory they are currently logged in from. For example, if logged into Confluence as a user from Crowd, the Crowd user directory will not be able to be modified. Normally we recommend logging in as the local Confluence admin in order to edit other directories.

However, when Crowd SSO is enabled, only users from the Crowd user directory can authenticate. To get around this, administrators will need to edit the seraph-config.xml to use the default Confluence authenticator instead of the Crowd SSO authenticator and restart Confluence in order to log in as the local admin. The application will require another restart to re-enable SSO.

This improvement request is to investigate if there's a better way to edit the Crowd user directory in Confluence when SSO is enabled.

The same is true of IIS with NTLM.
fields.summary: Provide a method for administrators to edit the remote user directory they are logged in from

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-28021].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
# An LDAP user directory in Confluence is created with 'Read Only with Local Groups'
# An LDAP user is then placed in a local group, e.g. 'confluence-users'
# Later, it is decided that this group's memberships will be handled in LDAP, and a group of the same name is created (again for example 'confluence-users')

The result is that the LDAP 'confluence-users' members never get synced over since there's already an existing local group of the same name that contained at least one LDAP member at some point in time.

h4. Purpose
The purpose of this improvement request is to investigate a way allow the LDAP group to override the local group in this senario. In the mean time, there's a workaround, detailed below.

h4. Workaround
When the LDAP user is placed in the local group, a new row will be created in the _cwd_group_ table associated the local group with the _directory_id_ of the LDAP user directory. The row will have the _local_ column set to 'T' indicating that it is not a group from LDAP.

This flag, when set to 'T', apparently keeps the LDAP group of the same name from syncing.

# Shut down Confluence
# Update the row such that the _local_ column is set to 'F'
# Start Confluence, which will trigger a sync on startup

Please note the impact this will have on your user memberships:
* Local users and groups are not affected
* LDAP users in the local group will no longer have that membership relationship
* LDAP users will now belong in the LDAP group of the same name
fields.summary: Investigate a way to override local groups with LDAP groups of the same name when using 'Read Only with Local Groups'

Error when adding a new page in a Space without Home page should be handled more gracefully. Currently it throws a System Error.

The system should display a warning informing the user that to be able to add a page, the space must have a Home page, because all pages created in a Space takes the Home page as their parent.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create a Space.
2. Remove its Home page (as per image below):

!step_1.png!

3. Try to add a new page:

!step_2.png!

4. The system throws an error:

!step_3.png!

*Workaround:*

1. Create/Open another Space
2. Copy its Home page
3. Move the copy to the homeless Space

Before the last major update (months ago, from what I recall), the search box at the top right of the Confluence page would auto-search and display search results as I typed. We usually title our projects with a case number, followed by description.

Ever since that update, that search function hasn't been auto-searching for new cases. Old cases will still appear in the auto-search, but new ones created after that update no longer appear. Instead, the only way I can get to them is to browse through all the project or do a CTRL + F for the case number. I'm surprised this hasn't been fixed, it's been like this ofr months.

Steps to reproduce:
1) From the dashboard, click "Add Page"
2) Give the page whatever name you like and save it.
3) Type the first few words or a unique word used in the page's title into the search box at the top right of the window.
4) Notice that it doesn't show up in the auto-search results.
5) Even if you hit <Enter> to submit the search, no results will be found.
fields.summary: Search box does not auto-find new cases
